nodes.body: I can't review the meta code. The rest LGTM. Thanks!
Wait why don't we instead fix the syntax to mean the correct thing?

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8732970427/job/23960798267)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8732970427/job/23960798533)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8732970427/job/23960798762)
@YaelDillies Do you think it would be better for it to say "expecting ','" rather than the way it gives an explanation for why having multiple binders is not allowed?

I'm not sure I understand your message.

What I mean is that `∃! a : α, p a` could be notation for `ExistsUnique (fun a ↦ p a)` while `∃! (a : α) (b : β), p a b` could be notation for `∃ a b, p a b ∧ ∀ a' b', p a' b' → a' = a ∧ b' = b` and etc with more binders.

"Fix the syntax" suggests changing the syntax, but you're suggesting changing the interpretation of the current syntax, which is very different. It's an interesting idea, but that's something that would need discussion.

Also, this PR doesn't exclude that idea from being implemented, so why the urgency with asking to wait?
No urgency. I was just surprised this suggestion hadn't come up.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: make `ExistsUnique` notation throw an error when used with more than one binder
